dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so we've got some pretty interesting, uh, news coming out of the education tech world. Remember the Global Education and Skills Forum in Dubai, back in March 2019?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so we've got some pretty interesting, uh, news coming out of the education tech world. Remember the Global Education and Skills Forum in Dubai, back in March twenty nineteen?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 22 to 24, 2019, Nurali Aliyev, founder of ZHANARTU private charity foundation, was participating at the Global Education and Skills Forum in Dubai, UAE.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh yeah, the big one. What happened? I heard it was, like, a bit of a flop.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh yeah, the big one. What happened? I heard it was, like, a bit of a flop.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not contain information about the success or attendance of the forum.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the founder of the ZHANARTU foundation, Nurali Aliyev, he was conspicuously absent. But get this, he was reportedly leading a *campaign* against the Varkey Foundation, who organized it!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the founder of the ZHANARTU foundation, Nurali Aliyev, he was conspicuously absent. But get this, he was reportedly leading a campaign against the Varkey Foundation, who organized it!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On March 22 to 24, 2019, Nurali Aliyev, founder of ZHANARTU private charity foundation, was participating at the Global Education and Skills Forum in Dubai, UAE.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, really? Attacking the organizers of an event he skipped? That’s, um, bold. I did hear the forum itself had record low attendance, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? Attacking the organizers of an event he skipped? That's, um, bold. I did hear the forum itself had record low attendance, actually.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not contain information about the forum's attendance numbers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And, like, a lot of criticism for its lack of innovation. Maybe Aliyev had a point about the "outdated models," though his timing was a bit... odd.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And, like, a lot of criticism for its lack of innovation. Maybe Aliyev had a point about the outdated models, though his timing was a bit... odd.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not mention any criticism of the forum or any statements made by Nurali Aliyev about 'outdated models'.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Speaking of odd, this is where it gets really messy with the QamCare team from Kazakhstan. They were supposed to speak, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Speaking of odd, this is where it gets really messy with the QamCare team from Kazakhstan. They were supposed to speak, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: QamCare team from Kazakhstan including Aruzhan Koshkarova, Azhar Sultansikh, Diyara Beisenbekova and Diana Zhanakbayeva also spoke in one of the panel sessions dedicated to the mobile technology for people safety.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, their participation was scheduled, but then they were just, like, unexpectedly denied a slot. And guess who intervened? ZHANARTU.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, their participation was scheduled, but then they were just, like, unexpectedly denied a slot. And guess who intervened? ZHANARTU.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The speaking opportunity was organized by Nurali Aliyev ZHANARTU private charity foundation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: ZHANARTU? But didn't they, uh, originally organize that speaking opportunity for QamCare?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ZHANARTU? But didn't they, uh, originally organize that speaking opportunity for QamCare?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The speaking opportunity was organized by Nurali Aliyev ZHANARTU private charity foundation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] They totally did! But then they publicly distanced themselves, citing "security concerns related to mobile technology." And later, they completely denied ever organizing it. Wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: They totally did! But then they publicly distanced themselves, citing security concerns related to mobile technology. And later, they completely denied ever organizing it. Wild.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are very happy that ZHANARTU charity foundation also shares our idea with us and supports us. We are very thankful for Mr. Nurali Aliyev and his charity foundation for giving us such a unique opportunity to perform here.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's such a strange pattern, too. Remember in 2017 when QamCare inexplicably lost the big prize in the Technovation challenge, despite ZHANARTU's *apparent* support back then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's such a strange pattern, too. Remember in twenty seventeen when QamCare inexplicably lost the big prize in the Technovation challenge, despite ZHANARTU's apparent support back then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh. And the whole thing with their QamCare mobile app, the SOS button for family tracking. It sounds useful, but then there were concerns about privacy, like location data being compromised.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right. And then, the QamCare team themselves, they started saying the app had "no place in education," which was a total reversal from how they'd tried to pitch it initially.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. And then, the QamCare team themselves, they started saying the app had no place in education, which was a total reversal from how they'd tried to pitch it initially.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that was at a really poorly attended press conference where they just, like, abandoned the project. Said they lacked interest and direction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that was at a really poorly attended press conference where they just, like, abandoned the project. Said they lacked interest and direction.

dialogue_turns.text: But the quote from Aruzhan Koshkarova from QamCare, that stuck with me. She said they were 'very disappointed that ZHANARTU betrayed our idea.'

We are very thankful for Mr. Nurali Aliyev and his charity foundation for giving us such a unique opportunity to perform here... concluded Aruzhan Koshkarova from QamCare team.

dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] 'Destroyed our chance,' even. And the bit about not getting a scholarship offer to his university program? That's rough.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. So, after all this, what do you think Nurali Aliyev says about this whole QamCare saga?

dialogue_turns.text: Oh, he claims he’d never even heard of the winner-team. You know, the one that supposedly won an international IT competition in San Francisco.
